DataElement.preferredName: Person Restless Leg Syndrome Symptom Assessment Score
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Person; a human being._A condition that occurs while resting or lying in bed; it is characterized by an irresistible urgency to move the legs to obtain relief from a strange and uncomfortable sensation in the legs._Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient._The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Person; a human being._A condition that occurs while resting or lying in bed; it is characterized by an irresistible urgency to move the legs to obtain relief from a strange and uncomfortable sensation in the legs._Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient.

Property.preferredDefinition: A condition that occurs while resting or lying in bed; it is characterized by an irresistible urgency to move the legs to obtain relief from a strange and uncomfortable sensation in the legs.:An indication that a person has a condition or disease.  Some examples of symptoms are headache, fever, fatigue, nausea, vomiting, and pain.

Concepts.definition: A condition that occurs while resting or lying in bed; it is characterized by an irresistible urgency to move the legs to obtain relief from a strange and uncomfortable sensation in the legs.
Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ReferenceDocuments.name: A questionnaire to assess Res
ReferenceDocuments.description: A questionnaire to assess Restless Legs Syndrome, which is an uncontrollable urge to move the legs to stop uncomfortable burning, itching, or tickling sensations.

DataElement.changeDescription: Changed from caBIG to PhenX for PANH by script 2015-12-21
